Django - how to view executed queries

You also can use python logging to log all queries generated by Django. Just add this to your settings file.

LOGGING = { 'disable_existing_loggers': False, 'version': 1, 'handlers': { 'console': { # logging handler that outputs log messages to terminal 'class': 'logging.StreamHandler', 'level': 'DEBUG', # message level to be written to console }, }, 'loggers': { '': { # this sets root level logger to log debug and higher level # logs to console. November 8th, 2012

Postgresql: show tables, show databases, show columns, describe table

mysql: SHOW TABLES
postgresql: \d
postgresql: SELECT table_name FROM information_schema.tables WHERE table_schema = 'public';

mysql: SHOW DATABASES
postgresql: \l
postgresql: SELECT datname FROM pg_database;

mysql: SHOW COLUMNS
postgresql: \d table
postgresql: SELECT column_name FROM information_schema.columns WHERE table_name ='table';

mysql: DESCRIBE TABLE
postgresql: \d+ table
postgresql: SELECT column_name FROM information_schema.columns WHERE table_name ='table'

[source][/source]http://www.linuxscrew.com/2009/07/03/postgresql-show-tables-show-databases-show-columns/
